OOC: We shalt not speak of the horrors of the Dark Ages of BWRPG
(another much earlier RPG that now exists partially inform of 
another). Then super blasts, the destruction of the Axalon, 
Trypticon! Metroplex! The Dinobots! Stasis lock Darts!!!! Yes those 
were the days tons of moding but it was all good and fun because many 
were expeirimenting and had no Idea what they were doing... 

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Soulstice Omega" <thecode@p...> wrote:
> OOC: I agree. I never had the rules explained to me when I first 
joined a year ago. I was new to the Internet and didn't know how to 
act, and besides that I started off as just a bad RPGer. Kyle 
Stewart, you start off as a good one, but with the same flaw as I 
originally had. Not knowing the rules. Of course, back then the rules 
page sucked, and it is nowhere near the grand spectacle it is today. 
It's not very descriptive and informative. But back to my point, I 
moded alot without even noticing it, and did things very similar to 
you, Kyle Stewart (if that's what you like to be called). I once even 
busted into a base and played around inside in one post because I was 
bored, and didn't know what I did wrong until months later!...
> 
>   ----- Original Message ----- 
>   From: robertdahl 
>   To: nbwrpg@y...

>   Subject: Re: Kyle Stewart
>

>   OOC: Cool of Legendarynemasis. He's new, and it takes a while to 
get the
>   rules, you above all should know that. Now you said that your a 
hot
>   head, so you should know it's not smart to go off yelling at 
people.
>   Kyle, don't worry, everyone's moded once or twice, but we've just
>   learned from our mistake. Again, talk to the council. Also, 
welcome to
